sen.j: 欠食児童（けっしょくじどう）とは、家庭の経済的困窮により、十分に食事を与えられていない子どものことである。
sen.e: Poorly-fed children are children to whom meal is not given enough by domestic economical poverty.
Poorly-fed children are children to whom meal is not given enough due to the economic poverty of the family.
sen.cmt: 理由を示しているので by domestic economical poverty→due to the economic poverty of the family.
sen.e: Poorly-fed children are children to whom meal is not given enough due to the economic poverty of the family.

sen.j: 日本では、特に学校へ弁当を持参できない子どもを指して使われることが多い。
sen.e: In Japan, it is likely to be used especially for children who cannot bring a lunch box to school.
In Japan, it is often used especially for children who cannot bring a lunch box to school.
sen.cmt: is likely to be used→is often used
sen.e: In Japan, it is often used especially for children who cannot bring a lunch box to school.

sen.j: 日本での欠食児童
sen.e: Poorly-fed Children in Japan
Poorly-fed Children in Japan
Poorly-fed Children in Japan

sen.j: 松方財政によるデフレーションで米価が低迷すると、定額金納の地租が農家に大きな負担となり、多くの農家が窮乏化した。
sen.e: When the price of rice was sluggish by deflation due to Financial Policy by Masayoshi Matsukata, the land-tax of fixed amount payment became a heavy burden on farmers, and many of them suffered from poverty.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を追加します。定額金納→fixed amount payment 定訳不明
sen.e: When the price of rice was sluggish by deflation due to the Financial Policy by Masayoshi Matsukata, the land-tax of fixed amount payment became a heavy burden on farmers, and many of them suffered from poverty.
sen.cmt: 定額金納→fixed amount payment 定訳不明
sen.e: When the price of rice was sluggish by deflation due to the Financial Policy by Masayoshi Matsukata, the land-tax of fixed amount payment became a heavy burden on farmers, and many of them suffered from poverty.

sen.j: 貧困の余り土地を手放して小作人化する者も増えた。
sen.e: As a result of the poverty, a lot of farmers gave up the lands and became a Kosakunin (tenant farmer).
As a result of the poverty, a lot of farmers sold out the lands and became a Kosakunin (tenant farmer).
sen.cmt: 手放す→sell outと思います
sen.e: As a result of the poverty, a lot of farmers sold out the lands and became a Kosakunin (tenant farmer).

sen.j: 松方財政以降、農村は慢性的な貧困状態に陥り、子どもの食事を十分に用意できない農家が多く存在することとなった。
sen.e: After the Matsukata Financial Policy, the life of farmers fell into chronic poverty and many farmers could not afford to prepare the meals for children.
After the Matsukata Financial Policy, the life of farmers fell into chronic poverty and many farmers could not afford to provide meals for children.
After the Matsukata Financial Policy, the life of farmers fell into chronic poverty and many farmers could not afford to provide meals for children.

sen.j: 農村の貧困は地主に土地を集積させ、彼らの資本は株式などの投資に向けられた。
sen.e: The poverty of farmers made land owners accumulate lands and their capital was turned to the investment such as stocks.
The poverty of farmers made land owners accumulate lands and their capital was turned to the investment such as stocks.
The poverty of farmers made land owners accumulate lands and their capital was turned to the investment such as stocks.

sen.j: 更に、農村は綿織物業等に従事した女性労働力に代表されるように低賃金労働力を創出し、日本の資本主義の発達を大いに促した。
sen.e: Moreover, the farmers created cheap labor, as typified by the female labor that worked in cotton textile industry, and promoted the development of the Japanese capitalism.
Moreover, agricultural villages provided cheap labor, as typified by the female labor that worked in cotton textile industry, and promoted the development of the Japanese capitalism.
sen.cmt: the farmers created cheap labor→agricultural villages provided cheap labor
sen.e: Moreover, agricultural villages provided cheap labor, as typified by the female labor that worked in cotton textile industry, and promoted the development of the Japanese capitalism.

sen.j: 日本の資本主義がこのようにして発展していったため、農村の貧困状態は改善されることがなかった。
sen.e: Since the Japanese capitalism had developed in this way, the poverty of the farmers was never improved.
Since the Japanese capitalism had developed in this way, the poverty of the farmers was never improved.
Since the Japanese capitalism had developed in this way, the poverty of the farmers was never improved.

sen.j: そして、1930年に発生した昭和恐慌により農村は大打撃を受け、東北地方を中心に各地で欠食児童が深刻な社会問題となった。
sen.e: The farmers were greatly affected by the Showa Depression in 1930, and the poorly-fed children became a serious social problem in various regions mainly in Tohoku.
The farmers were greatly affected by the Showa Depression in 1930, and the poorly-fed children became a serious social problem in various regions mainly in Tohoku.
The farmers were greatly affected by the Showa Depression in 1930, and the poorly-fed children became a serious social problem in various regions mainly in Tohoku.

sen.j: 戦後、連合国軍最高司令官総司令部は、日本の軍国主義の温床となった寄生地主制を改革するために農地改革を断行し、自作農が多く誕生した。
sen.e: After the war, the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) pushed the farmland reform to reform the parasitic landlord system which had become a hotbed of Japanese militarism, and it turned many farmers into the land-own farmers.
sen.cmt: 寄生地主制→parasitic landlord system定訳不明
sen.e: After the war, the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) pushed through the farmland reform to reform the parasitic landlord system which had become a hotbed of Japanese militarism, and it turned many farmers into land-owning farmers.

After the war, the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) pushed through the farmland reform to reform the parasitic landlord system which had become a hotbed of Japanese militarism, and it turned many farmers into land-owning farmers.

sen.j: しかし、一人あたりの耕地面積は狭く、農家は零細的経営を余儀なくされたため、農村の貧困状態を根本的に改善することはできなかった。
sen.e: However, the cultivated land per farmer was narrow and the farmers were forced to manage small farm, the poverty of the farmers had never been fundamentally improved.
However, as the area under cultivation per farmer was small and the farmers were forced to manage small farms, the poverty of the farmers was never fundamentally improved.
sen.cmt: 接続詞asを追加します英辞朗より耕作面積area under cultivationを用います。narrow→small,複数形に変えます。時制を訂正します。
sen.e: However, as the area under cultivation per farmer was small and the farmers were forced to manage small farms, the poverty of the farmers was never fundamentally improved.

sen.j: そのため、戦後も農家を中心に、欠食児童は多く存在し続けた。
sen.e: Therefore, even after the war, many poorly-fed children were remained in the farm family.
Therefore, even after the war, many poorly-fed children remained in the farm family.
sen.cmt: remainは自動詞なので受身になりません。
sen.e: Therefore, even after the war, many poorly-fed children remained in the farm family.

sen.j: しかし、給食制度が一般化し、高度経済成長を経て日本が名実共に先進国の仲間入りをすると農家の経済状態も向上し、今日では欠食児童という言葉は死語になりつつある。
sen.e: When a school lunch program was generalized and Japan became one of the advanced countries both in name and reality through a high economic growth, the economic conditions for the farmers were improved and the word of 'Poorly-fed Children' became obsolete today.
sen.cmt: Poorly-fed Children に''をつけ加えました。
sen.e: When a school lunch program was generalized and Japan became one of the advanced countries both in name and reality through the high economic growth, the economic conditions for the farmers were improved and the word of 'Poorly-fed Children' became obsolete today.

When a school lunch program was generalized and Japan became one of the advanced countries both in name and reality through the high economic growth, the economic conditions for the farmers were improved and the word of 'Poorly-fed Children' became obsolete today.

sen.j: しかし、以前と比べると少数ではあるが、現在も存在するのは事実である。
sen.e: Although the number of poorly-fed children is decreasing, it is true that they are still remained today.
Although the number of poorly-fed children is decreasing, it is true that they still remain today.
sen.cmt: remainは自動詞なので受身になりません。
sen.e: Although the number of poorly-fed children is fewer than before, it is true that they still remain today.
sen.cmt: decreasingをfewer than beforeとしました。

sen.e: In other countries, a deficiency of food became a serious problem in many developing countries mainly in Africa and children, so called 'Poorly-fed Children' in Japan, has increased.

sen.j: これらの国々ではほぼ例外なく人口が急増しており、将来の見通しも明るくない。
sen.e: These countries are facing a rapid increase in population and their future prospects are not bright.
These countries are facing a rapid increase in population and their future prospects are not bright.
These countries are facing a rapid increase in population and their future prospects are not bright.

sen.j: 世界から「欠食児童」がいなくなる日はまだ当分訪れそうにないのが現状である。
sen.e: The day to eliminate 'Poorly-fed Children' from the world is long in coming.
The day to eliminate 'Poorly-fed Children' from the world is long to come.
The day when the issue of 'poorly fed children' is eliminated will be a long time coming.

sen.j: また、韓国のように、比較的経済が発展しているにも関わらず、欠食児童が社会問題となっている国も存在する。
sen.e: And, there is a country like Korea, even if the economy has been growing, the poorly-fed children becomes a social problem.
And, there is a country like Korea where even if the economy has relatively grown, the poorly-fed children becomes a social problem.
